# Loadout System
Save your gear setup and re-equip quickly after death or when switching roles.
[color=#FFD700][bold]This feature is in beta. There is a small possibility of losing items.[/bold][/color]
## Quick Save / Quick Load
The fastest way to save and restore your equipment.
[bullet] [bold]Quick Save[/bold] - Saves everything you're currently wearing
[bullet] [bold]Quick Load[/bold] - Re-equips your quick-saved gear from your stash
Perfect for getting back into the Zone fast after respawning. Update it whenever you upgrade your gear.
## Named Loadouts
Create multiple saved loadouts for different situations:
[bullet] A combat loadout with heavy armor and weapons
[bullet] A stealth loadout with light gear for artifact hunting
[bullet] A trading loadout with extra carrying capacity
Enter a name (up to 32 characters) and click [bold]Save New[/bold]. Your loadouts persist between sessions.
## What Gets Saved
[bullet] All equipped clothing and armor
[bullet] Weapons and their attachments
[bullet] Magazines with their current ammo count
[bullet] Items in your backpack, vest, and pockets
[bullet] Items inside containers (nested up to 5 levels deep)
## What Does NOT Get Saved
[bullet] Items held in your hands
[bullet] Your ID card / PDA
[bullet] Implants and organs
## Preview
Click any loadout to see a preview showing exactly what items will be equipped. You can rotate the preview to inspect your gear from all angles.
## Missing Items
If items from your loadout aren't available, they're marked as [color=#FF6B6B]missing[/color]. The preview panel shows which items you need to find.
[bold]You can still load a partial loadout[/bold] - available items will be equipped and missing items will be skipped.
## How Loading Works
When you load a loadout:
[bullet] Items you're wearing that match the loadout stay equipped
[bullet] Items you're wearing that aren't in the loadout go to your stash
[bullet] Loadout items are retrieved from your stash and equipped
[italic]Good hunting, stalker.[/italic]
